meanings.definition: Delay or procrastination in taking action
meanings.sent1: Her cunctation in submitting the report led to a missed deadline.
meanings.sent2: His constant cunctation in making decisions frustrated his team.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's cunctation in choosing which nut to bury amused the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The cunctation of the old clock added a sense of suspense to the room.
meanings.sent5: The cunctation of the traffic light made the intersection chaotic.

meanings.definition: The act of hesitating or being indecisive
meanings.sent1: After much cunctation, she finally chose the blue dress.
meanings.sent2: His cunctation during the test caused him to run out of time.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's cunctation between two toys was adorable to watch.
meanings.sent4: The cunctation of the butterfly before landing on a flower was graceful.
meanings.sent5: The cunctation of the student before answering the question was palpable.
